signature.instructions:
You are given:
- passage: a short text (often in Hausa; sometimes mixed).
- question: a multiple-choice question about the passage.
- answer_list: an ordered list of answer options.

Your task:
Select the single best option based ONLY on the passage and return:
- reasoning: a brief justification in the same language as the passage/question (usually Hausa), citing an exact short clause from the passage or summarizing it concisely.
- correct_answer_number: the 1-based index of the chosen option in answer_list (an integer only, no quotes).

Strict output format:
- Provide exactly two top-level fields: "reasoning" and "correct_answer_number".
- Do not include the answer text, extra fields, or any explanations outside "reasoning".
- Keep "reasoning" short (1–2 sentences) and evidence-based.

Method:
1) Read the question carefully and classify it:
   - Direct fact lookup (who/what/where/which).
   - Synonym/definition mapping (parenthetical expansions or category names).
   - Temporal order/sequence (“fara”, “daga nan”, “sannan”, “daga baya”, “a ƙarshe”, “karshe na biyu/penultimate”, “kai tsaye kafin”).
   - Negation/exclusion (“ba … ba”, “bane/bace/ba wanda”, “wanda bai … ba”, “ban da”, “ba a ambata ba”).
   - Quantifier/scope precision (“duka/kowane”, “wasu”, “yawancin”, “akalla”, “kusan”, “fiye da”).

2) Locate the exact sentence(s) in the passage that answer the question. Quote a short supporting clause or summarize it concisely in Hausa in your reasoning. Prefer explicit statements over inference.

3) Map the passage wording to the answer options precisely:
   - Prefer exact phrasing from the passage when present.
   - Handle common synonym/abbreviation mappings:
     • “Masu tattaunawa/masu sasantawa” ⇒ negotiators.
     • “Jami’ai” ⇒ officers.
     • “Rundunar kashe gobara/ma’aikatan ceto na wuta” ⇒ fire department/firefighters.
     • “Muridai Masu Juyi/Dervishes” ⇒ Whirling Dervishes.
     • “Wutar Anatoliya” ⇒ Fire of Anatolia.
     • Award categories:
       – “Fitaccen Jarumi/Jaruma” ⇒ Lead/Best Actor/Actress (“Babbar Tauraruwa Mafi Fice”), NOT supporting.
       – “Ƙaramar Tauraruwa” ⇒ Supporting Actor/Actress.
     • Parenthetical titles map to the primary/English title if present in options (e.g., “Audition (Wawaye Waɗanda Suke Mafarki)” ⇄ “Audition”).
   - For recognition/behavior questions, map concrete triggers from the passage (e.g., “musamman wanda yake da launuka masu haske” ⇒ “Sanya mayafi mai ɗan haske”).

4) Temporal nuance and scope:
   - Distinguish general/ancient evidence from formal “as a sport/event/award” starts. For questions like “aka fara … a matsayin wasa,” prefer institutional/competitive starts (e.g., “An fara tseren … wajajen ƙarni na 17”) over ancient depictions (“zanen kogo … 5000 BC”).
   - For dates and sequences, be exact with order terms:
     • “karshe na biyu” = penultimate (second-to-last).
     • “a ƙarshe/domin kammala” = final/last.
     • “kafin/kai tsaye kafin” = immediately before.

5) Handle negation/exclusion and quantity carefully:
   - If the passage says “Ba a bayar da rahoton … ba,” do not infer the opposite.
   - Distinguish “wasu/yankuna” (some/parts) and “yawancin” (most) from “duka/kowane” (all). Only choose universal claims if explicitly supported.
   - For “wane ne ba …” or “ban da,” select the option explicitly excluded by the relevant passage/timeframe, even if mentioned elsewhere.

6) Use only information from the passage. Do not rely on outside knowledge or plausibility.

Language:
- Write “reasoning” in the same language as the passage/question (usually Hausa). If mixed, prefer Hausa terms used by the passage.
- Keep reasoning concise (1–2 sentences) and include a brief quote or very short Hausa summary that directly supports the choice.

Quality checks before answering:
- Ensure the chosen option is explicitly supported by the quoted/summarized sentence(s).
- Verify universal vs scoped claims.
- For sequence/temporal questions, identify the exact order/timeframe intended (e.g., “a matsayin wasa” ⇒ formal/competitive start).
- Confirm the index is 1-based and output as a bare integer (no quotes, no text).
- Do not include the answer text itself; only the index.

Output example shape (do not include this note in your answer):
{
  "reasoning": "Quote or concise Hausa summary that directly supports the choice.",
  "correct_answer_number": 2
}
